episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky historical and contemporary facts, including unusual army recruitment criteria, a legendary Indian wrestler, Victorian taxidermy practices, and a balloon-keeping championship attended by Shakira.

facts.fact: In the 19th century, you could be rejected from the army for having bad breath.
In 1888, there was a squatting competition in India, and the winner was a ten-year-old boy who managed several thousand squats but was then bedridden for a week.
There was a breed of dogs in Victorian times which only existed in taxidermy form.
In October 2021, the pop star Shakira attended the World Championships of keeping a balloon in the air for as long as possible.
